history.content:
Data 8 is very easy for people with cs and stats experience. Some people like that were studying for other finals during the data 8 final when I took the class.

____________________________________________________________

I would just like to add that unless you are majoring/minoring in data science or plan to take classes that enforce Data 8 as a hard prereq, it'd be a waste of time for you and you'd be much better off focusing on the rest of your classes in your already challenging schedule.

-------------

Adding to the above answer, I would not recommend taking Data 8 either. Last semester, I took the class after declaring CS, and though the class was interesting and I got some stuff out of it, I felt like the stuff I learned in the class could be easily self-studied.

Data 8 is very easy for people with cs and stats experience. Some people like that were studying for other finals during the data 8 final when I took the class.

____________________________________________________________

I would just like to add that unless you are majoring/minoring in data science or plan to take classes that enforce Data 8 as a hard prereq, it'd be a waste of time for you and you'd be much better off focusing on the rest of your classes in your already challenging schedule.
Data 8 is very easy for people with cs and stats experience. Some people like that were studying for other finals during the data 8 final when I took the class.

My current schedule consists of EE120, EE126, and Physics 7A. I plan to do research in the Fall and join a tech club. I've heard Data 8 is a pretty easy class after taking the entire 61 series and 70, which I just completed. And I plan on pursuing a joint discipline in ML and Signals.

Would it be worth it to add Data8 to this course load? Would it be too much? I'm all ears for any opinions regarding the value and feasibility of taking Data8.
history.subject: Adding Data8 to EE120, EE126, Phys7A
